website_summaries.verdict: This multi-functional TV and laptop tray may be more expensive, but it addresses many of the issues many people face when confined to a recliner or lift chair during post-surgical recovery. 360-degree swivel action.
pros: Sturdy tray table swivels away easily
Cane handle provides leverage while sitting or standing
4 height settings for a customized fit
cons: Does not fit securely under certain types of furniture
Hardware can be challenging to assemble

customer_reviews.title: Awesome table and cane!
customer_reviews.text: My Mom absolutely loves this table! Very convenient rotates 360 degrees! Perfect next to recliners and it assists her in feeling secure when operating the lift portion of the chair and in getting out of recliner!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Nosek

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: this could have caused a serious injury!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this the end of November and by the beginning of April the weld on the bottom foot is broken. You can see that it's not even a full weld and is completely useless at this point. The sad part is that the handle part was not even used until this week for support in rising after a very recent surgery.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for my mother who is disabled. I originally got a hospital-like table but she had difficulty getting her feet over the bottom of the table. The Able Life tray works perfectly with the other tray. I like the fact that it is small just right for her plate and drink, and the other table we use for the items she needs to keep out and have handy.
customer_reviews.author: msbeve

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice laptop tray except it is too small for a 15-inch laptop. The cup holder is under the right rear corner of the laptop. It needs to be about 4 inches wider or deeper or both. Another nice feature would be if it could be tilted but is not necessary. Overall it is the best table I have found for using my laptop while sitting in my recliner. It was easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: msmoers

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the tray
customer_reviews.text: After only 24 hours of use my 92 year old mother managed to rip the tray off the stand with her lift chair. Broke it right off. You would not think someone of her age would be able to do that right? I have contacted the seller about a possible tray replacement. I would still recommend the product. My mother in law has used this product for 10 years without an issue. It is generally a good sturdy product. Works as intended.
customer_reviews.author: J King

customer_reviews.title: Seniors will need help setting this up
customer_reviews.text: Just moving the furniture is bad enough to require someone strong. The weight and high quality of the device requires some strong help to handle putting it in. We are VERY happy with the gadget. The ability of the table to swing multiple ways (including well out of the way) makes it perfect for the job we asked it to do. It was a little tricky to set up with his lift chair, but we figured it out, and it does work very well. Hint: The distance from the chair is what makes it work with a lift chair. Bigger poofy ones may have more issues.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Cornett

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: My dad had cancer when I purchased this product for him. He needed it more and more as he became more and more dependant on assistance. The handle was perfect for him to hold and assist him with his weight. The tray has a nice wide arc so its easy to move out away from the person and then slide back in. The feet positioned perfectly under his chair. I could not have been happier with this product and would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: bripl

customer_reviews.title: missleading
customer_reviews.text: i bought this thinking this would be very helpful for my elderly dad (91) but the main base leans really bad and try they its self is not level it has a horried slant to it. so when u place a plate or other things on table it slides right off. the hole thing is not straght nor level. i bought this from my hard earned cash. i am not a paid reviewer. and be wanrded they dont support returns. i did resolved this (i hope) with amazon tho.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Nice articulating table but did not work for our lift chair.Use as additional table instead.
customer_reviews.text: This table is a nice companion to most any heavier chair or sofa. Did not work with our lift chair because it did not allow the chair to lift to a standing position before the chair would hit the arm of the table. We used a chairlift table for that spot. We now use it for our laptop since our caregiving role is no longer needed. This is a great articulating table which we use between our couch and chair as a side table that will postion in front of either while it is placed under the chair legs. Works well and adjusts to most needs. Highly recommend for boost to rise or just extra table.
customer_reviews.author: SFG

customer_reviews.title: It work but
customer_reviews.text: It's great! Extremely sturdy. Adjustable height and angle of the table. Very easy to put together, with adequate instructions. BIG problem is rubber base pads are meant to be anchored down by an EZ chair with four feet. Lift chairs ( most recliners) does not have "feet" but rather square metal rails centered under the chair. It's very difficult to properly place the rubber pads securely under this rail .It makes the lift chair leaning to one side. So I put spacers under the other side of the rail of the lift chair.
customer_reviews.author: jawsz

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for a while
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for a while, but then my elderly mother in law called me to say the tray had fallen off the base. When I examined the part it was clear that the screws attaching the tray to the base stripped the wood. This was preassembled. I then took the tray, filled the holes with wood filler and re-drilled properly sized holes. Poor assembly from the factory. Luckily it did not fall apart when a hot meal was on the tray or an injury could have resulted.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Has made my life easier and safer!
customer_reviews.text: This table with arm support is the best thing we've purchased in years. I was a little hesitant because of the price, $150 for a tv tray? What? But it is terrific! The bottom slides under my power chair and installation is complete! The handle is strong, i use it to pull myself out of my recliner. The table top swivels 360 degrees, is sturdy and oh so convenient.. I can eat any meal while sitting, when done, just smoothly slide it around. I don't usually.write reviews unless requested but the table and handle are too wonderful not to brag about. Great job in making it, great job in 'inventing' it and it really is worth the cost of it.
customer_reviews.author: june Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This couldn't have been more perfect. Bought this for my grandpa's 86th birthday. He mainly watches videos on his chromebook and this was so adjustable, now his neck and back are properly placed and he won't be leaning over so much like he was when he had it in his lap!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. well made
customer_reviews.text: It has really been helpful with my Dad having to take his meals in his chair. We have a swivel rocker but managed to get enough of it on to the tray feet to keep it in place. My Dad has dementia and is constantly trying to take the tray "off" but it wont budge, very sturdy. I just swivel it out of the way and he forgets its there. It would be helpful, to have a lip around the side next to the person so plates cant slide off. Otherwise its perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ceej

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something for my Mom, who is 90 years young, to use as a table and to help steady her when getting out of her recliner. The Able Life Able Tray Table - Bamboo Swivel TV Laptop Tray Table For Lift chair or couch + Ergonomic - Safety Support Mobility was perfect. She has a lift chair so instead of securing it as is depicted in the photo, we put the pads under the front of the lift chair and it worked perfectly. We were able to make the adjustments easily and she is delighted with it and so is the family.
customer_reviews.author: Pol

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for mom
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for my mom who needed a tray for the occasional meal, plunking on her iPad and miscellaneous other tasks. She loves this. It is quick to put together and works precisely as advertised. I love how the chair sets on it, so we don't have to worry about tipping over, etc. I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RNT

customer_reviews.title: The BEST
customer_reviews.text: Table is the BEST. Great mid century look and it swivels 360 degrees. EASY to assemble and totally necessary for caring for an elderly friend or relative. Have already bought another one for the sunroom. HIGHLY recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: ldean

customer_reviews.title: Pricey a bit but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my elderly father. He loves it. I adjusted the base pads to sit under the feet of the couch and placed it next to his lifting chair. He just swings the attached table out of the way and can lift the chair and use the grip assist handle to help him. It is a little pricey but worth it I suppose as it is stable, well made, and really makes him happy so he can eat a snack or hold his drinks.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Installation is impossible without lots of help!
customer_reviews.text: This is can not be placed without having four healthy strong people. I bought this because my son was having back surgery we got it and he(back) me disabled and his wife tried to place it under chair legs ridiculous then the bar doesn’t clear arm of chair just horrible wasted money. Cause without being under legs of chair can’t be used cause has no stability. installation Is impossible without lots of help.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L

customer_reviews.title: caution
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product and the table is entirely too tall to use with my laptop, (no fault of the product itself) and the stand assist handle interferes with the mechanism for my recliner (its a zero clearance recliner- that means the arms slide forward when you raise the foot of the chair) in order for the chair to operate properly, the handle must be placed too far away from the feet of the recliner, thus becoming unstable. This chair is not returnable so be cautious before ordering. The ad says you can call the company before ordering. Again, I suggest caution.
customer_reviews.author: Clever San Diego

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this thing. I've even used it a couple times. Very strong very sturdy. Easy to assemble. Very well made. Cup holder and the movability of the table is amazing. I would recommend it to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: lifeiswonderful

customer_reviews.title: My inlaws LOVE this table
customer_reviews.text: This is especially a great gift for the Senior "who has everything". My FIL needs support when getting up from a chair so I thought this table would be an asset. I had no idea how truly thrilled both in-laws would be with the table.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my mom who is 88 and pretty much lives in her chair. That is okay if she is in comfort and this tray provides that. She uses it for meals reading and more. It is especially well made. It can turn all the way from in front of her to the arm of her chair and probably could keep going if the arm of the chair did not get in the way. But no reason for it to go that far! It cost more but this is one of those times that the saying you get what you pay for it very true!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: This has been perfect for my mom. I would definitely recommend. It works great for helping her to get up because she has bad knees and it is hard to get up. It is nice to have the table so she can keep her drink right beside her and if she desides to she can eat and watch her shows. We like that the little table rotates and swings out.
customer_reviews.author: mel_dyh

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: Does not work with all recliners. AND IS NOT RETURNABLE/REFUNDABLE
customer_reviews.text: The table is very far forward on the chair, and if chair arms are high, then the table is too high to be useable. The table’s legs must fit under the chair’s legs, and this can be a problem for proper alignment of the table with the chair.
customer_reviews.author: SanFranReader

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice and versatile stand
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice and versatile stand. My problem was we have a love seat that has large arms and it has electric recline. The legs on this are too short to go under far enough to get under the sofa legs. This is very well built and I had to jury rig a fix to get it to work. I wanted to return it but Amazon said It was not returnable. Again it is nice and very sturdy. I would have given it a 5 star rating IF it would have gone under the sofa feet or frame
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Listing measurements don't include size of the pads that fit under the chair
customer_reviews.text: First, my chair has a lot of space between the side of the chair and the metal support rails it sits on. Because of this, the table pads aren't long enough to reach those rails. We did manage to move the back pads as far forward as it would go, then turn the whole tray so that the back pads kinda sorta reach. The end result, however, is that the tray stays under the chair but leans dramatically and wobbles a lot.
customer_reviews.author: G Gates

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my grandmother for Christmas and she's thanked me every time we talk! She says it helps her keep things close and even uses it to help pull herself up.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Sims

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and helpful table
customer_reviews.text: Swings out of the way when not needed. Swings just where you need it! Handy to hold dinner in front of TV or a beverage. Sturdy enough to assist my husband out of chair. It has even survived the grandkids playing with it!
customer_reviews.author: Donna B.

customer_reviews.title: A Great Invention!
customer_reviews.text: This thing REALLY helps my aging mother who has mobility issues, just had a hip replacement and lives alone. Getting in and out of the recliner was very difficult and painful for her before I installed this. Also the laptop had always been on a table to the side causing neck/shoulder strain/pains from constantly reaching to the side to use it. The built in table can now be spun around to be right in front of her. Much better ergonomically. And this thing is ROCK SOLID, VERY STRONG.
customer_reviews.author: J. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: What a convenience!
customer_reviews.text: I hated around side tables for my Mom to use to eat at. Now, no more table in the middle of room! Swings easy too. It could have been a bit larger, that’s the only semi-negative comment I have to add. I still would buy this regardless as it makes my life easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: 3 months and broken
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for a relative. it never stays under the chair legs and needs to be constantly adjusted. this could be a minor inconvenience except today i discover the "weld" on the table is breaking and the tray will fall off any day now rendering this table unusable. this is outrageous and i will begin the process of getting a refund.
customer_reviews.author: greengirl2

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and useful
customer_reviews.text: I have installed a couple of these for my husband, who has Parkinson's. The handle is handy for him to hold onto when he gets in and out of his chair. The table is study and can swing around to be in front or to the side. And it has a handy cup depression to hold his drink. I have only 2 complaints and fixes. (1) He doesn't always see the handle (it's black). I wrapped it in bright green tape. (2) The tray is slippery and dishes slip around. I took a rubber bathmat, cut it to size and plunked it on top -- problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Levine

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my mother with limited mobility. Fit perfectly under her recliner. Works great, she eats her meals in the chair and the tray table is nice to have. She can get up easier with the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Great table,
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves it. She doesn't know how she got along with out one. Great table, easyadjustment,05/02/15 However we finally got her lift chair. Its Golden 510 model. Now we have a problem. The feet are not long enough to fit under the feet f the chair. The armrest sticks out quite a bit Is there n extension for the foot resits (pads) Pl;ease help me solve this problem, The table is useless as it stands. Thank you, Robert N Nicholson elagantes@aol.com 5/06/15 again, as to theprior message. Is there any adapters foextend the feet?? Bob Nicholson elagantes@a0l.com
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Lea Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and set up and the table top is OUTSTANDING.
customer_reviews.text: Although I purchased this 3-4 years ago. I wanted to say how well it was made and how well it functioned for my mother in her nursing home room. It was the hit of the nursing home actually. The administrator called me to find out where I obtained it as many had come to her wanting to know when they passed my mothers room. The rotating table top was a great convenience for mom wanting to eat her meals I her room when I would visit and bring her "real food" aka something not from the nursing home kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it seems like she will be able to use it pretty well
customer_reviews.text: gave it to my mother who is 93 and has parkinsens, it seems like she will be able to use it pretty well. Easy assembly, anyone can do it. Seems to be fairly sturdy, could improve the design by shortening the protruding metal on bottom of the table arm so it can swing over the padded arm of a couch or chair at a lower level...not a big deal, just an improvement that could be made
customer_reviews.author: blacklisted

customer_reviews.title: Assistive device for recliners
customer_reviews.text: This device helps my friend to rise and stand from his recliner. When he is seated, he can use the tray table for snacks and cup holder for his water. He uses the tray table to support his reading materials. The tray easily swivels out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: L Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Isn't quite level
customer_reviews.text: The table slopes really bad. Everything rolls off. Installed securely and all bolts tightened snugly. At least my tablet doesn't slide off. Provided a picture with my review, but Amazon denied my review for some reason...? Sorry, no pic attached this time to see if this goes through.
customer_reviews.author: Landru

customer_reviews.title: Feet to short
customer_reviews.text: Feet are too short to fit under large chairs or recliner handles. Had to add bracing to chair to extend chair footprint out. Leaves device too unstable as pull and can only be used for balance
customer_reviews.author: Steven M. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: You need to be able to get it under a sturdy chair. You need 2 people to lift and one to slide and position. Once it's in its a nice addition to steady yourself to get up and the tray is convenient. It also adjusts to multiple positions
customer_reviews.author: Sbsb

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Able Tray for my aunt who has increasingly struggled to get in and out of her couch over the past few years. The wide handle lets her leverage herself to the front of the chair and to get up far more easily. The tray is also perfect for her because she eats most of her meals while watching TV. Easy setup and assembly was a huge plus! Worth the $$.
customer_reviews.author: Sally Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for a friend to use under her lift recliner. So far it seems to do the trick. It is very heavy, seems to be made sturdy. The tray rotation works as described. The handle is very useful to help her stand up since she has very limited mobility in her legs. I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: V. Heath

customer_reviews.title: Best tray stand ever .
customer_reviews.text: Does all it advertises . Ease and versatile . clever support system , using the weight of chair or couch to support what ever you place on table top . Multiple adjustments possible . 360 degree swing on table makes it so that once in , place say in center of couch , it can be used on either right or left side seat .
customer_reviews.author: Grover Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good design, wears out
customer_reviews.text: The one we just bought is the second one my wife has had. The first one lasted 5 to 10 years, but everything got loose and it just wasn't working right anymore. The new one is of course like new. There are other similar devices, but this one has the grab handle as well, which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: W. Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Elderly Mom LOVES this!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my elderly Mom as she is has trouble getting around now. I wish I knew about this table years ago! It has helped her tremendously. She is able to maneuver in & out of her chair mush easier now.
customer_reviews.author: Lesa F.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The tray tilts and doesn't seem to be adjustable making things that re put on it lide off. And because it is plastic, can't support my father getting out of his chair. Pulling on it makes it seem unstable. Should have 4 feet instead of 2.
customer_reviews.author: GYM5686

customer_reviews.title: Glad we found this
customer_reviews.text: This has been such a great item for my elderly relative. Like others have suggested, I used the small pieces of cardboard from the box to shim up the other side of the power recliner to offset the base of the tray table. With that small step, the tray is very stable and the chair is again level.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra H.

customer_reviews.title: Get one for your loved one,make their life easier.
customer_reviews.text: Mother in law loved it,worked perfectly. She's 92 years old
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great table !
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my elderly dad. It allows him to eat and get up from his lazy boy. He loves the table and it has a cup holder so his drinks dont fall over when He is eating. Perfect for anyone with hip surgeries or limited mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great adjustable Tray Table
customer_reviews.text: The tray table is sturdy and was very easy to assemble. One person can do it in less than 1/2 hour. All required tools were included. The table has adjustable height options. The tray table swivels easily in all directions. The handle is a good option for those who need a boost getting out of a chair.
customer_reviews.author: dagit

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this for my elderly mom
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for something that wasn't flimsy for my mom. This is sturdy and wonderful for her to get up out of her chair. She loves how it swings, the cup holder and how she can use it to get in/out of her chair.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great for seniors!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 87 yr old father who has Parkinson's and Neuropathy in hands. He tends to drop things a lot. This helps catch most of everything making it easier for him to retrieve. Great for laying his books on to read.
customer_reviews.author: jgb

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together, is very sturdy, the table top is not laminate (one of my worries) but is solid bamboo. It really has helped me in getting up from the couch - a lot less of a struggle. I am very happy with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Jo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect item for my mom
customer_reviews.text: We were hesitant to buy this because you never know how something will work when you get it. My brother and I watched the video before ordering for my mom, who is in a nursing home recovering from a stroke. This works perfectly for her when she's sitting in her lift recliner. The fact that it is adjustable and swivels is great! She was unable to really reach her food on the big hospital type rolling tray. All of the aides and nurses have raved about how great it works
customer_reviews.author: Dolphinfan

customer_reviews.title: Bought for wife
customer_reviews.text: Wife has an easy-lift chair, customized for a 5 foot person. unable to adjust downward enough for this chair (too high when she sits in normal position) but works fine on the normal sized couch.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Powell

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: this works great for my sister-in-law who is impaired with a shoulder/arm injury. She put it on the end of her couch and uses it for all her meals as well as coffee. She says the handle is great so she can get up and down without asking for help.
customer_reviews.author: Bdavil01

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for us
customer_reviews.text: My mom has this next to her lift chair. She loves it and it works really well. She feeds her oxygen line through the handle so it doesn't fall on the floor when she gets up. The cup holder and tray work well and she uses the handle when she gets up. It's perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A. Frick

customer_reviews.title: Exactly right -- and medical-grade quality
customer_reviews.text: My mother spends most of her time in her easy chair, in fact sleeping there frequently. We wanted something akin to a hospital bed tray, but with a fixed base and a tray that would swivel out of the way to get up and down. This is solid and sturdy, assembles easily and adjusts just as simply. There's even an adjustment screw to prevent "slouching" of the tray. Very pleased with this chair-side tray.
customer_reviews.author: BlueSkies425

customer_reviews.title: Christmas gift for Mom
customer_reviews.text: My mom does crafts and this table seemed the perfect addition to her craft needs. I would have given a 5 star, but I do wish it had the ability to lock the table into a tilt position for such tasks like reading. My mom really likes it and I specifically purchased the one with the handle so it can assist her get up from the seated position.
customer_reviews.author: Merlin

customer_reviews.title: Great to help elderly out of their chairs
customer_reviews.text: My mom is 90. Hard for her to get out of her recliner. This is an awesome product.
customer_reviews.author: Diemont

customer_reviews.title: Grandma loves it.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my grandma while I was visiting her. The box was missing the long screw that is supposed to come with it. I was worried I wouldn't get a replacement in time to put it together for my grandma doing our visit, but I contacted the manufacturer and they mailed me out the missing part quickly, so I was able to set it up in time. It is very sturdy, grandma can use it to get up from her chair, and she uses the swing away table for everything. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: MEASURE FIRST even thought they do not tell you to do that.
customer_reviews.text: The tray is a bit flimsy. THe issue is that the base pads can only reach a set distance to the feet of the furniture. The page says that it fits all furniture. But my simple loveseat recliner feet are too far from the edge of the furniture arm for the pad of the tray table to be secure. So after 40 minutes of unpacking and set up. I had to pack it up. and ship it back. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Levin

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, well made, good design.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this table for my brother who is handicapped. Because the chair legs hold the table in place, it's very sturdy, even when he leans on the cane to stand. The table height is adjustable and it swings very freely. The pencil tray and cup holder.incorporated into the tray are nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: M7

customer_reviews.title: It's dignified as it doesn't look like it belongs in a hospital
customer_reviews.text: This is a neat tray! I purchased two trays for my Mom (one for her chair and the other for her bedroom) and she absolutely loves it. It's dignified as it doesn't look like it belongs in a hospital.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and sturdy table.
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several other trays like this but I have found this product to be very reliable, sturdy and safe. I would recommend this product for any person with difficulty with mobility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Pasco

customer_reviews.title: Granny loves it
customer_reviews.text: Grandmother loved this... And we all feel better about her keeping her laptop on it instead of trying to move it one handed onto her lap. She has a lift chair and we had no problems with the two working together. Was very easy to assemble - took me maybe 30 minutes of casually working on it while chatting with family.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Tray more useful than chair cane
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband. It was very easy to assemble and is very stable. But he finds the chair cane to be awkward to use...I am still having to pull him up.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Works, But ...
customer_reviews.text: I need assistance in getting up from my swivel, rocker recliner. This does the trick. However, it doesn't work well because the base of my chair is round and the product is intended for more rectangular bases. It works, but it tilts a bit forward and I lost the swivel/rocker features of my chair. Like others have mentioned, I had to build up the other side of the chair base, so it didn't tilt to the side that doesn't have the handle, I used a rubber mat about 2" thick. Much less expensive than a lift chair, so the annoyances are worth the price difference. Swivel tray is nice.
customer_reviews.author: inastrol

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dad who lives with us and he loves it so much. Getting his TV tray in and out was such a hassle but this is so easy and he can easily move it on his own when he needs it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product. Works the way it should and is not imposing in size. Been really wonderful for my 89 year old dad. I like how easy it moves and also like the cup holder. Its

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: My mother is 91 years old and was using one of those tv trays to eat her breakfast, lunch and dinner on. The stand was so wobbly and unsafe. I couldn't believe when I found this on Amazon and couldn't wait for her to get it. This is wonderful and wish I had found it years ago. She loves that when the tray is not in use, she can just push it around to the side and not worrying if it was going to fall over. An amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Gannon

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Stander Assist-A-Tray's as a Christmas gift for my dad. It was very easy to assemble - bascially unfold and screw in 3 bolts for the base and tray. The tray is a little small but did function very well for what my dad wanted. He really liked the handle for the stability of getting in and out of his chair and the ability to move the tray out of his way without having to move the entire stand. The stand gave him the ability to do something as simple as getting up out of his chair without having to ask for help. I would highly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: My 89 year old mother doesn't move well, has failing health, and spends a lot of time sitting in her recliner to either read, watch tv and even eat these days. The assist a tray has enabled her to keep drinks, papers, and medicines within easy reach. Several people have asked where she got the "unique" tray. Though we did have a little problem setting it up under her recliner because the recliner doesn't have individual feet like the picture shows and the depth of the seat is shorter than the shortest length of the base, we were able to make it stable enough that it is an asset for her.

I like the cup holder and the small catch tray, however I think the tray as a whole could be a little larger. Good quality. A little overpriced in my opinion, but not sorry I bought it .
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality - Excellent Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift for my mom. My brother-in-law installed it for her. I recently went to visit her and saw that it did not have the tray attached. It turns out there was an error in shipping. Update: I received a quick response from manufacturer with a commitment to fix the shipping error. The Tray was shipped soon after and everything was taken care of. The quality of this product is excellent and my Mom loves it. I strongly recommend this brand!

customer_reviews.title: Very Stable, Table... Not so much
customer_reviews.text: The table is great stability wise. The table slants even with trying to level it by adjusting the screws. Have to tighten them every once in a while. Bought it in July and in December (6 months later) the table wood is starting to crack. But everything else is still stable. Four stars because of the stability and that the table was useful for light stuff.

product_meta.title: Able Life Able Tray Table, Adjustable Bamboo Swivel TV and Laptop Table with Ergonomic Stand Assist Safety Handle, Independent Living Aid
feature_bullets: PROVIDES BALANCE AND SUPPORT: Able Life’s ergonomic safety handle provides balance and support when sitting and standing from your favorite couch, lift chair, or recliner; our mobility handle can support up to 250 pounds; safety handle measures 6 by 6 inches

BAMBOO TRAY TABLE: Our multi-use bamboo TV tray table measures 16 by 18 inches and provides plenty of room for laptops, meals, books, and other tabletop activities; includes a built-in cup holder and utensil compartment; with 360 degrees of swivel motion, easily pivot the tray table out of the way when not in use; safely supports up to 30 pounds

HIGH QUALITY AND EASY TO ASSEMBLE: Easily assemble and securely install the adjustable Able Tray Table under the feet of most four legged couches, lift chairs, or recliners with feet 20 to 36 inches apart; each tray includes all the needed equipment for assembly, no additional tools required; not intended for freestanding use

SUPER GRIP STABILITY PADS: The dual sided rubber stability pads are designed to adjust to the distance between the front and back legs of your favorite couch or chair while protecting your floor from damage; feet of couch or chair can be placed on either the outside or inside of the stability pads; each side of the base feet measure 4 by 7 inches

FULLY ADJUSTABLE: Customize the Able Tray to your individual comfort and furniture; tray height adjusts from 26 to 32 inches; support handle height adjusts from 34 to 40 inches; base length adjusts from 20 to 36 inches; please reference our assembly video and infographics to determine if the Able Tray Table is compatible with your furniture
